reviewText: We're in familiar Second World War territory here - fighting the military bureaucracy in an attempt to save refugees (a mixture of Jews, Communists, artists, writers, and other "undesirables"), interned in a camp in southern France, before the arrival of the German forces, when those refugees will inevitably be turned over to the Germans and whatever fate has in store for them. Still, it's well done, and all the more compelling because it is based on fact. Interestingly, the film does take an unexpected (for this kind of film) turn at the end. Certainly worth a look.
I would have prefered if it were an English audio version - I can't rtead that sub text fast enough
